newsitem.title: USA: Skyline revises exchange offer terms.
newsitem.headline: Skyline revises exchange offer terms.

text.p: Skyline Multimedia Entertainment Inc said Wednesday it has revised the exchange rate in its exchange offer for all outstanding class A and Class B warrants of the company.
It said it will now offer to exchange one newly issued common share for 3.5 class A warrants and one newly issued common share for seven outstanding class B warrants.
The previous exchange terms called for the exchange of four class A warrants and eight class B warrants for each newly issued common share.
The exchange offer remains conditioned on a minimum tender by holders of at least 75 percent outstanding warrants of each class, it said.
Skyline is a holding company for New York Skyline Inc, which operates New York Skyride, an entertainment flight stimulator located in the Empire State building.
